title: Mobile Microlearning for IMC (Integrated Marketing Communication) Practical Skill Enhancement: Data-Driven Decision-Making Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic marketing theory and practical experience. Requires understanding of foundational statistical concepts (mean, standard deviation) and ability to perform simple formula calculations
context.additional_context: Focuses on bridging theory-practice gaps through experiential client-based learning. Requires smartphones, considers PC-unavailable environments. Uses mobile-friendly data analysis tools (e.g., Google Sheets mobile app) for probability calculations and graphing tasks

learning_goals: Analyze real client cases to develop an integrated implementation plan for IMC strategies and apply optimization equations (e.g., linear programming) based on budget allocation data.

Learners complete a 4-week team-based experiential learning project (e.g., marketing data analysis task), achieving a score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) in at least four out of five rubric items: communication (3 meeting minutes), organizational management (task allocation chart), and leadership (role adjustment). Decision-making using probabilistic modeling during budget allocation is specifically assessed.

Learners independently apply IMC tools (e.g., content calendars, budget allocation sheets) in a mobile microlearning environment, enhancing competencies in data visualization (graph generation using spreadsheet functions) and statistical analysis (probability distribution calculations).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
